content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Find the current number one artist on the Spotify Global Top 50 chart and list his/her top 10 songs as of now.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search for Spotify Global Top 50. I'll type query into search box.
Action: Type 1; Spotify Global Top 50
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open Spotify Global Top 50 playlist link.
Action: Click 1745
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open Lady Gaga artist page via link in row 1 to get her top 10 songs.
Action: Click 869
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to expand the Popular tracks to view top 10 songs.
Action: Click 3290

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to bring the "See more" button into view or load more popular tracks before clicking; I'll scroll down the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Click “See more” in the Popular section to reveal songs 6-10.
Action: Click 3290

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to return to the Global Top 50 playlist page to double-check which artist is currently #1.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open Lady Gaga artist page from first-row artist link to collect top 10 popular songs.  
Action: Click 6331
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Expand the Popular section to display songs 6–10.  
Action: Click 7473

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to expand the “Popular” tracks list by clicking the visible “See more” button.
Action: Click 7473

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perhaps the additional popular tracks will load as we move further down the page; I’ll try scrolling the window to bring them into view.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try clicking the “See more” button (id 7473) under the Popular section so tracks 6–10 appear.  
Action: Click 7473

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The additional popular tracks might be inside a scrollable grid (element 7469). I’ll scroll within that grid to reveal songs 6-10.
Action: Scroll 7469; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to verify #1 track on Spotify Global Top 50 via SpotifyCharts website (no login required) to confirm the artist, then gather their Popular top-10 songs. I’ll start a new Google search.  
Action: Google
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform Google search for Spotify Global Top 50 chart.
Action: Type 1; Spotify Global Top 50
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Return to Lady Gaga’s Spotify artist page (previous page) so I can expand the “Popular” list and capture her top-10 songs.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need search results again; type query for Spotify charts global daily to open list and identify #1 artist.
Action: Type 1; Spotify charts global daily
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open Spotify Charts overview to see the latest Global chart and identify the #1 track/artist.
Action: Click 4941
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open the public “Top 50 ‑ Global” Spotify playlist (result 5001) to see the current #1 track and determine its artist.  
Action: Click 5001

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Spotify Charts site requires login; better to return to Google results and open the public “Top 50 – Global” playlist on open.spotify.com.  
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Open the “Top 50 – Global” playlist on Spotify (link 5001) to view the current #1 track and its artist.  
Action: Click 5001
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The #1 track is "Die With A Smile" credited to Lady Gaga and Bruno Mars. I need the artist’s page to list their top 10 popular songs; I’ll open Lady Gaga’s artist link (869).  
Action: Click 869
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Expand the “Popular” tracks list to reveal songs 6-10 by clicking the “See more” button.  
Action: Click 3288

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I should scroll the page a bit to ensure the “See more” button in the Popular section is properly in view before clicking it.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to expand the Popular list to obtain songs 6–10. I’ll click the “See more” button (element 3288).  
Action: Click 3288

The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try scrolling within the Popular-tracks grid (#3284) itself; extra songs may be hidden there.  
Action: Scroll 3284; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I should bring the “See more” button fully into view before clicking it to show songs 6–10. I’ll scroll down the main window a bit more.  
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.
